alerts.headline: squall warning in effect
alerts.description:
Squalls with wind gusts up to 35 knots are expected or occurring in the area.

###

Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. For more information monitor Canadian Coast Guard radio or Weatheradio stations.
alerts.instruction: Mariners are advised to prepare for squalls. If underway, seek safe harbour immediately. Consider delaying or postponing travel in areas under the squall warning.

alerts.headline: squall warning in effect
alerts.description:
Squalls with wind gusts up to 35 knots are expected or occurring in the area.

Thunderstorms approaching from Minnesota may be capable of producing wind gusts to 35 knots. These storms are likely producing up to toonie sized hail.

###

Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. For more information monitor Canadian Coast Guard radio or Weatheradio stations.
alerts.instruction: Mariners are advised to prepare for squalls. If underway, seek safe harbour immediately. Consider delaying or postponing travel in areas under the squall warning.

alerts.headline: squall warning in effect
alerts.description:
Squalls with wind gusts up to 35 knots and frequent lightning are expected or occurring in the area.

###

Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. For more information monitor Canadian Coast Guard radio or Weatheradio stations.
alerts.instruction: Vessels without lightning protection should make their way to shore immediately. Mariners are advised to prepare for squalls. If underway, seek safe harbour immediately. Consider delaying or postponing travel in areas under the squall warning.

alerts.headline: squall warning in effect
alerts.description:
Squalls with wind gusts up to 35 knots and frequent lightning are expected or occurring in the area.

Thunderstorms approaching from Minnesota are likely producing ping pong ball sized hail.  These storms may also be capable of producing wind gusts to 35 knots.

###

Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. For more information monitor Canadian Coast Guard radio or Weatheradio stations.
alerts.instruction: Vessels without lightning protection should make their way to shore immediately. Mariners are advised to prepare for squalls. If underway, seek safe harbour immediately. Consider delaying or postponing travel in areas under the squall warning.

Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. For more information monitor Canadian Coast Guard radio or Weatheradio stations.

alerts.headline: squall warning in effect
alerts.description:
Squalls with wind gusts up to 35 knots and frequent lightning are expected or occurring in the area.

Thunderstorms tracking northeast over Lake of the Woods are capable of producing wind gusts to 35 knots and nickel sized hail.

###

Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. For more information monitor Canadian Coast Guard radio or Weatheradio stations.
alerts.instruction: Vessels without lightning protection should make their way to shore immediately. Mariners are advised to prepare for squalls. If underway, seek safe harbour immediately. Consider delaying or postponing travel in areas under the squall warning.

alerts.headline: rainfall warning in effect
alerts.description:
Rain, at times heavy, is expected.

What:
Total rainfall amounts of 50 to 75 mm. Amounts in excess of 75 mm are possible for areas that receive multiple thunderstorms.

When:
This evening through Sunday.

Additional information:
Showers, at times heavy, and thunderstorms are expected to move through northwestern Ontario ahead of a low pressure system. The significant rainfall will move from southwest to northeast, with multiple rounds of heavy showers possible for some areas, before tapering off late Sunday.

For information concerning flooding, please consult your local Conservation Authority or Ontario Ministry of Natural Resources office. Visit Ontario.ca/floods for the latest details

###

Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Localized flooding in low-lying areas is possible.

Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@ec.gc.ca or post reports on X using #ONStorm.
alerts.instruction: Watch for possible washouts near rivers, creeks and culverts.
